item.title: Perth's queer nightclub, Connections, celebrates 50 years of dancing and difference
item.description: Founded in 1975, when homosexuality was still illegal in Western Australia, Connections nightclub has seen waves of social change and kept the party going.

item.title: Google to build undersea cables in Papua New Guinea under Australia defence treaty
item.description: PNG says the measure will provide a key upgrade to its digital backbone and link the north and south of the nation with high-capacity cables.

item.title: Government-formed agency recommends against NSW coal industry expansion
item.description: Coal mining extensions and expansions will continue, the New South Wales premier says, despite a government-appointed agency finding further approvals were not consistent with emissions targets.

item.title: Australian fans among most active in searching for FIFA World Cup tickets
item.description: Australia are among the countries with the most ticket requests for next year's World Cup, which is bound to please Socceroos coach Tony Popovic and his team.

item.title: A wig, boat and private jet: The clandestine mission to get Maria Machado out of Venezuela
item.description: Maria Corina Machado hid in fear for her life under Venezuela's Maduro regime. This is how her fight to restore democracy started more than 20 years ago.

item.title: What you should know about 'Bali belly' and how to avoid it before it ruins your holiday
item.description: Every year about 1.5 million Australians travel to Bali. Chances are either you or someone you know has caught a stomach bug after travelling to the popular Indonesian destination. So what can you do to avoid it?

item.title: Children 'traumatised' as wheel flies off speedway car into crowd at Avalon Raceway
item.description: Race spectators were metres away from a flying wheel that tore through a fence after detaching from a sprint car at the Fireball Derby last night near Geelong.

item.title: Desert Fireball Network students find fist-sized meteorite in outback WA
item.description: PhD students from Curtin University have found a 300-gram meteorite after a five-day search in remote bushland.

item.title: United Nations delegation warns of Australia's treatment of prisoners, detainees and breach in human rights
item.description: A delegation of United Nations inspectors have raised the alarm about Australia's detention facilities and a breach of human rights.

item.title: Severe heatwave cancels event, closes popular abalone fishing spot as season begins
item.description: Perth is in the grip of its hottest spell so far this summer, forcing the closure of a popular tourist attraction as abalone fishing season got underway.

item.title: Jailed Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi's supporters rally in Sydney to protest junta elections
item.description: Aung San Suu Kyi's son leads a rally of supporters in Sydney as part of global demonstrations trying to increase international pressure on Myanmar's ruling military junta.

item.title: Roger Rasheed slams 'battle of the sexes' tennis clash between Nick Kyrgios and Aryna Sabalenka
item.description: High-profile Australian tennis coach Roger Rasheed has questioned the value of the upcoming "battle of the sexes"-style exhibition match between Nick Kyrgios and Aryna Sabalenka.

item.title: China Coast Guard fires water cannon at Philippine fishing vessels in South China Sea, Manila says
item.description: Manila's coastguard says nearly two dozen Philippine fishing boats near Sabina Shoal were targeted with water cannon and blocking manoeuvres on Friday.

item.title: Belarus releases Nobel winner Ales Bialiatski, top opposition figures as US lifts more sanctions
item.description: Belarusian authorities release 123 prisoners including Nobel Peace Prize laureate Ales Bialiatski and key opposition figure Maria Kolesnikova, after talks with an envoy for US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Hard Quiz: It's the season of giving so I'm gifting you a chance at redemption
item.description: Your track record doesn't leave me hopeful.

item.title: Sanction-skirting 'shadow fleets' in Trump's sights. Here's how they work
item.description: Tensions between the US and Venezuela are soaring after American forces seized an oil tanker in the Caribbean Sea. So why is US President Donald Trump targeting so-called "shadow fleets"?

item.title: How Benjamin Netanyahu's corruption trial became a struggle for Israel itself
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's backers view his corruption trial as a witch hunt — but his detractors argue it is the system finally catching up to a ruthless political operative who is prepared to do anything to hold on to power.

item.title: Demerit point return scheme to be made permanent in NSW
item.description: Since the trial to return demerit points began almost two years ago, more than 1.7 million licence holders have benefited from their safe driving.

item.title: Two US troops killed in Syria ambush along with one American civilian
item.description: Two US service members and one American civilian are killed in an ambush in central Syria.

item.title: Teaching on country in remote East Arnhem Land
item.description: This remote East Arnhem land community is home to 50 permanent residents. There's no shop and only one road in or out. And its unconventional approach to teaching is keeping kids in the classroom.

item.title: After tragedies and rescues, Tasmanian bushwalkers urged to 'be prepared' for all conditions this summer
item.description: It has been a busy year for search and rescue operations in the Tasmanian high country. Authorities say a concerning number of visitors to the state's famous national parks are ill-prepared for the fickle weather — even during summer.

item.title: Iron deficiency is a challenge for many female athletes, like Super Netball's Zara Walters
item.description: Zara Walters felt tired, dizzy and unable to recover from training sessions — then she found out she was low in iron. It's a condition that often goes undiagnosed, especially in female athletes.

item.title: Gippsland teenager Ethan Monck celebrates first job after a lifetime battling cancer
item.description: Ethan Monck's health problems began the day he was born. Now aged 17, he's celebrating after starting his first job and the freedom it gives him to pursue his hobbies.

item.title: The Kaurna cultural program inspiring students in Adelaide's south
item.description: Kanyanyapilla means "place of many eagles", and it's where Indigenous students in Adelaide are coming to connect with Kaurna culture.

item.title: Sydney Sweeney transformed herself to play Christy Martin in a biopic as Hollywood struggles
item.description: Sydney Sweeney changed a lot about herself to play Christy Martin in a biopic about the boxer. She says it was a role she had to take.

item.title: Lionel Messi's India tour begins in chaos, seats ripped out in Kolkata
item.description: Indian football fans ripped up seats and invaded the pitch in Kolkata as Lionel Messi's first appearance in India took a chaotic and dangerous turn.

item.title: Medical groups push for consequences for freebirth 'birthkeepers' posing as medical professionals
item.description: A number of recent deaths linked to freebirths — where a pregnant woman chooses to give birth with no registered medical professional present — is prompting health groups to speak out about rising levels of misinformation.

item.title: Israel says Hamas commander Raed Saed was among five killed in Gaza City attack
item.description: It was the highest-profile assassination of a senior Hamas figure since a Gaza ceasefire deal came into effect in October.

item.description: Christopher Tilse has worked from dawn to dusk in a bakery most of his life. Dementia made that a challenge, but thanks to family support, he is still baking.

item.description: It's called the 'bush capital', but three quarters of Canberra's suburbs have recorded a decline in tree coverage.

item.description: Aspiring Darwin filmmakers with disabilities have been getting job-ready, developing skills in scriptwriting, directing, cinematography and editing. It's the first time the program has been offered in the NT, with plans for it to expand even further.

item.description: Four passengers in a van, who are yet to be formally identified, died at the scene, north of Shepparton in Victoria. Five injured people, including three children and the male driver, were taken to various hospitals.

item.title: Manhunt for Brown University shooter renewed after police release detained man
item.description: With police releasing a person of interest, the manhunt continues for the Brown University shooter who killed two students and injured nine others.

item.title: Darts player Cameron Menzies apologises after punching a table following world championship loss
item.description: A Scottish darts player has apologised to fans after he punched a table during a loss at the world championship.

item.title: Advocates express concerns over ACT government wombat management plan
item.description: The ACT government is considering how to better manage the territory's wombat population, in response to challenges being experienced by farmers.

item.title: Noosa region hit with minor flooding, with isolated storms, rain and cooler temperatures forecast for Queensland
item.description: Storms and heavy rain are forecast to again hit large parts of Queensland today, with temperatures dropping across much of the sunshine state.

item.title: London plane trees to be removed in Hamilton following infrastructure concerns
item.description: Twenty-five London plane trees are set to be removed from Hamilton after they were found to be causing problems with local infrastructure.

item.title: NSW cricketer banned from playing after allegations of nude photos being sent to teammates
item.description: A NSW cricketer, who has played at Sheffield Shield level, is banned from playing after allegations he sent nude photos to young teammates.

item.title: Umpires pull Pakistan one-day skipper Shaheen Afridi out of Big Bash attack following full-toss drama
item.description: Umpires in the Big Bash clash between the Renegades and Heat sensationally pull Shaheen Afridi out of the attack after two full-toss deliveries.

item.title: Consent laws now protect sex workers against non-paying clients
item.description: Victims say NSW Police's frontline officers are still catching up with the changed legislation, which makes non-payment for sexual services a criminal offence.

item.title: The Bondi shooter only had a basic gun licence. How could he buy multiple high-powered rifles?
item.description: The Bondi shooter's gun licence entitled him to an uncapped quantity of certain kinds of rifles and shotguns.

item.title: The best board games to play (and gift) this summer
item.description: Over the holiday period, the right game can make all the difference while spending time with friends and family.

item.description: The consumer watchdog is suing home meal delivery providers HelloFresh and Youfoodz for allegedly misleading consumers over subscriptions.

item.description: A Bywong man pleads guilty in the Queanbeyan Local Court to aggravated animal cruelty after dragging a conscious kangaroo behind his car earlier this year.

item.title: Farmers' Facebook group racks up 100,000 followers as they seek support across seasons
item.description: A group dedicated to Australian grain farming created more than a decade ago has just cracked 100,000 followers with about 20,000 people following from overseas.

item.title: Tributes flow after Australian Paralympic bronze medallist Nicholas Hum dies aged 32
item.description: Australian Paralympic bronze medallist Nicholas Hum is mourned after his shock death aged 32.

item.description: US President Donald Trump has filed a defamation lawsuit against the BBC in Miami federal court, seeking at least $US10 billion ($15.1 billion) in damages.

item.title: Bendigo Writers Festival debacle continues as La Trobe University is asked to apologise
item.description: The debate around the failed Bendigo Writers Festival, which will not run next year, again embroils sponsor La Trobe University in controversy amid calls for more transparency and accountability.

item.description: It took me a long time to decide to get a cat, and just as long to adopt after I had decided. When I saw Giles, any lingering uncertainties I had disappeared.

item.title: Premier Roger Cook handed extra powers as pro-development laws pass WA parliament
item.description: The powers allow WA Premier Roger Cook and a bureaucrat to sign off on projects with "strategic or economic significance", sparking concerns about the wide-ranging powers and potential environmental impact.

item.description: A man is charged after allegedly wearing a necklace displaying a Nazi symbol, caught by increased police patrols in WA after the Bondi terror attack.

item.description: The Northern Territory's top-scoring year 12 students have been celebrated at a ceremony at Parliament House, with some keen to pursue teaching careers inspired by the classroom support they received

item.title: SA government doubles Holocaust education funding after Bondi terror attack
item.description: A Holocaust survivor says the Bondi terror attack should be "a wake-up call" for the nation as the South Australian government double its funding for education programs.

item.description: One year before Reuven Morrison was killed during the Bondi Beach massacre, he issued a dire warning about escalating antisemitism in Sydney.

item.description: As firefighters continue to battle bushfires across WA's south-west land division, a century-old mission, which was part of the Stolen Generations history, has reportedly been badly damaged in the fire.

item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley will head the internal group aiming to intensify scrutiny of the federal government's response to antisemitism.

item.title: Mid-year budget update to show $8.4b improvement to bottom line
item.description: A combination of savings and higher tax takes have delivered an $8.4 billion improvement to the federal budget's bottom line, the mid-year update is expected to show when it is released on Wednesday.
